body.p:
Georgetown Ky Jany 22nd 1864
To His Excellency
Thomas E. Bramlett
Governor of the Commonwealth of Ky
Dear Sir

100
Whereas it is Represented to me that a murder has been committed ^in Scott County^ on the person of Jeremiah Martin under agravated circumstances, implicating in unmistakable grounds of suspicion that the same was commited by a slave belonging to W B Galaway ^named Rial^ who has fled from Justice.

2 S.V.
And whereas a murder was also committed in said county by John Spencer on the person of David C Covington a union soldier from Said county, your excellency is most respectfully requested to offer a Reward for the aprehension of both the parties implicated, both of whom have fled from Justice

Respectfully
J G Morrison
Presiding Judge Scott Co Ky.
The Slave Rial is about 35 years old 5 feet 8 high rather small black with the front lower foretooth out -- speaks slow and low and has an humble appearance

Reward
Scott Co
$100 --
$250 --
Rial a slave
$100 --
John Spencer
$250 --
